overview.business_description: Over-the-counter pharmaceutical manufacturer producing and distributing self-care products across 100+ consumer health brands globally. Carved out from Sanofi and acquired by CD&R in April 2025. Brands include Dulcolax, Allegra, Essentiale, and other OTC medicines.
business_positives: Very low distress score of 7 - performing credit
Recurring revenue from essential healthcare products
Former Sanofi division with proven track record
overview.fatal_flaw: New LBO with significant leverage (~$8.4bn debt). Limited standalone track record post-separation. OTC market competitive with J&J, GSK, Haleon. Integration/carve-out execution risk.
overview.ownership: Private - PE-owned. Clayton Dubilier & Rice (CD&R) Fund XII owns 50% stake since April 2025.
overview.recent_news: Repriced EUR 1.7bn and USD 3.8bn TLB to E+325bps/S+300bps at par (Oct 2025). Original TLB priced at E+350bps/S+325bps and SSN at 5.5%/6.5% (Mar-Apr 2025). $9.07bn acquisition completed Apr 2025.

quick_assessment.note: New LBO - limited standalone financials. Large debt quantum for carve-out.

key_ratios.note: Financials not yet publicly reported post-separation. Leverage likely 5-6x based on LBO sizing.

maturity_schedule.note: Well-termed maturity profile - RCF 2031, TLB/Notes 2032. No near-term maturities.

credit_opinion.summary: OHG/Opella is a strong performing credit with very low distress score (7). This is CD&R's carve-out of Sanofi's consumer health division - a leading global OTC pharma platform with 100+ established brands. All debt trading above par (100-103) with successful TLB repricing to E+325bps/S+300bps in Oct 2025 demonstrating strong market confidence. While leverage is elevated for a new LBO (~$8.4bn debt), the business has stable recurring revenue from essential healthcare products. Well-termed maturity profile with no maturities until 2031-2032. Strong sponsor backing from CD&R.
key_risks: New LBO with elevated leverage (~5-6x estimated)
key_catalysts: Rating assignment - likely BB-range given pricing
Further TLB repricing if spreads tighten
Bolt-on M&A to expand brand portfolio

distress_indicators.trading_signals: All debt at 100-103 (above par). Successful repricing to E+325bps/S+300bps shows strong market support. Very low distress score for new LBO.
